item.title: 个人电脑芯片市场回暖，英特尔作出令人鼓舞的预测
item.description: 在个人电脑需求增长之后，英特尔公司（Intel Corp. ）给出了乐观的收入预期，从而提振了人们对这家陷入困境的芯片制造商卷土重来的乐观情绪。【原文：Intel Corp. gave an upbeat revenue forecast after personal computer demand grew, boosting optimism about a comeback attempt by the embattled chipmaker.】

item.title: OpenAI 合作伙伴克鲁索在新一轮融资中估值达 100 亿美元
item.description: Crusoe 正在德克萨斯州为 OpenAI 和甲骨文公司运营一个大型数据中心综合体，该公司表示已筹集了 13.8 亿美元的股权，公司估值超过 100 亿美元。【原文：Crusoe, which is operating a major data center complex in Texas for OpenAI and Oracle Corp., said it has raised $1.38 billion in equity, valuing the firm at more than $10 billion.】

item.title: 美国考虑提升量子计算能力以对抗中国
item.description: 特朗普政府正在与量子计算公司进行早期对话，讨论为该行业提供财政支持的可能性。【原文：The Trump administration is in early-stage conversations with quantum computing companies to discuss potential financial support for an industry that’s part of the growing race with China for technology supremacy.】

item.title: 破产的 PrimaLend 将次贷 "周期 "归咎于寻求银行帮助
item.description: 汽车经销商向信用记录不佳的买家放贷，导致次级贷款机构 PrimaLend Capital Partners 破产，该公司在法庭文件中称。【原文：Auto dealers who lend money to buyers with spotty credit histories pushed subprime lender PrimaLend Capital Partners into bankruptcy, the company said in court papers.】

item.title: Beyond Meat 的备忘录股票复活，创下零售交易记录
item.description: Beyond Meat Inc.的复活不仅使这家无肉汉堡肉饼生产商从历史最低点回升，还引发了零售交易活动的狂热。【原文：The resurrection of Beyond Meat Inc.’s meme status not only lifted the producer of meatless burger patties from record lows, but also incited a frenzy of retail trading activity.】

item.title: 降低 CPI 目标可为南非节省 520 亿美元债务成本
item.description: 南非央行行长莱塞特贾-卡冈亚戈（Lesetja Kganyago）强调了降低通胀目标的好处，称这可在十年内为政府节省多达 9000 亿兰特（520 亿美元）的偿债成本。【原文：South Africa’s central bank Governor Lesetja Kganyago reinforced the benefits of a lower inflation goal, saying it could save the government as much as 900 billion rand ($52 billion) over a decade in debt-service costs.】

item.title: 随着牛群数量下降，嘉吉利用人工智能从骨头上获取更多肉类
item.description: 随着美国牛群数量减少到七十年来的最低水平，嘉吉公司（Cargill Inc.【原文：Cargill Inc. is turning to artificial intelligence to ensure it gets more beef from its processing plants as the US cattle herd dwindles to the lowest level in seven decades.】

item.title: 投资者疑虑增加，塞内加尔债务创三个月新低
item.description: 塞内加尔的美元债券触及三个月低点，因为人们再次担心这个西非国家不断膨胀的债务负担及其能否达成国际货币基金组织的救助协议。【原文：Senegal’s dollar bonds touched a three month low amid renewed concerns over the West African nation’s ballooning debt burden and its ability to reach a deal for an International Monetary Fund bailout.】

item.title: 瑞银的赫拉维和赫德伯格将加入加拿大皇家银行，共同推进股票衍生品业务
item.description: 加拿大皇家银行资本市场部（RBC Capital Markets）从瑞银集团（UBS AG）招聘了两名高级员工，以扩大其在股票衍生品市场的业务，该银行正在向华尔街长期由自营交易公司主导的这一领域挺进。【原文：RBC Capital Markets is expanding its presence in the equity derivatives market with two senior hires from UBS AG, as the bank pushes into a part of Wall Street long dominated by proprietary trading firms.】

item.title: 私人信贷机构正在接管电信供应商 Netceed
item.description: 彭伯顿资产管理公司（Pemberton Asset Management）、蓝猫头鹰资本公司（Blue Owl Capital Inc.【原文：Lenders including Pemberton Asset Management, Blue Owl Capital Inc. and Hayfin Capital Management are taking over struggling telecoms supplier Netceed through a debt-for-equity swap.】

item.title: 苹果售价 99 美元的新背带让佩戴 Vision Pro 更轻松自如
item.description: 苹果公司去年发布 Vision Pro 时，这款耳机有三大缺点：3499 美元的起价、不舒适的设计和有限的内容选择。【原文：When Apple Inc. released the Vision Pro last year, the headset had three main drawbacks: a $3,499 starting price, an uncomfortable design and a limited selection of content.】

item.title: 科威特称欧佩克成员国已准备好在必要时提高产量
item.description: 科威特石油部长表示，如果需求需要，欧佩克准备增加石油产量。【原文：Kuwait’s Oil Minister said that OPEC is prepared to increase oil production if demand requires it.】

item.title: OpenAI 收购由前苹果员工创办的人工智能初创公司
item.description: OpenAI 收购了软件应用公司（Software Applications Inc.Software Applications 公司成立于 2023 年，创始人是一群苹果公司的前员工，其中一些人帮助开发了 iPhone 捷径应用背后的技术，该应用旨在加快智能手机上常用功能的运行速度。作为此次收购的一部分，OpenAI 计划在未来几年内整合【原文：OpenAI has acquired Software Applications Inc., a startup building an AI-powered user interface for Mac desktops, part of a push by the ChatGPT maker to improve how artificial intelligence tools field tasks on a computer. Software Applications was founded in 2023 by a group of former Apple Inc. employees, some of whom helped create the technology behind the iPhone’s Shortcuts app, which is designed to speed up common functions on the smartphone. As part of the acquisition, OpenAI plans to integr】

item.title: 苹果公司因应用程序商店收费 "过高 "在英国集体诉讼中败诉
item.description: 苹果公司在英国的集体诉讼中败诉，因为法院裁定该公司滥用其支配地位，向应用程序开发商收取过高的佣金。【原文：Apple Inc. lost a class-action in the UK after a court ruled that it abused its dominant position to charge excessive commission from app developers.】

item.title: 为什么 "备忘录股票 "狂热不断？
item.description: 10 月中旬，随着 Beyond Meat 公司股价在四天内飙升超过 1300%，华尔街再次掀起了一股 "备忘录股票 "热潮。这股突如其来的涨势与科威德病毒大流行时的狂热如出一辙，社交媒体影响者所追捧的绩差股也不时掀起异常大幅的跳水。【原文：A meme-stock craze took hold on Wall Street once again in mid-October, as shares of Beyond Meat Inc. surged more than 1,300% over a four-day period. The sudden rally echoed frenzies that originated during the Covid pandemic and have periodically set off unusually large jumps in beaten-down stocks championed by social media influencers.】

item.title: 抗议活动爆发，喀麦隆将互联网中断归咎于电缆被切断
item.description: 喀麦隆当局将这个面临选举后动乱的非洲中部国家的互联网中断归咎于海底电缆被切断。【原文：Cameroonian authorities blamed an internet disruption in the central African nation that’s facing post-election unrest on a submarine cable cut.】

item.title: 赵明被特朗普赦免后，Binance 的代币大涨
item.description: 在交易所联合创始人赵长鹏获得美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的特赦后，作为其同名数字资产平台的主要交易代币，也被称为 BNB 的加密货币 Binance Coin 跳涨了 8%。【原文：Binance Coin, a cryptocurrency also known as BNB that is the main transactional token on its namesake digital asset platform, jumped as much as 8% after exchange co-founder Changpeng Zhao received a pardon from President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 南非央行称南非需要改革应对美国关税
item.description: 南非央行表示，南非需要加快结构性改革，以减轻美国总统唐纳德-特朗普惩罚性关税对经济的影响。【原文：South Africa needs to fast-track structural reforms to cushion the economy from the effects of US President Donald Trump’s punishing tariffs, the country’s central bank said.】

item.title: 美国抵押贷款利率降至一年多来最低水平
item.description: 抵押贷款利率降至一年多来的最低水平，缓解了购房者对负担能力的担忧。【原文：Mortgage rates fell to the lowest level in more than a year, easing affordability concerns for homebuyers.】

item.title: 卖美国 "贸易的问题
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. item.title: 米莱伊将在关键选举前两天会见戴蒙并与首席执行官交谈
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱伊（Javier Milei）将在摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）本周访问布宜诺斯艾利斯期间与其会面。【原文：Argentine President Javier Milei will meet with Jamie Dimon during the JPMorgan Chase & Co. chief executive’s visit to Buenos Aires this week, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 伊朗最大的银行之一在收紧标准的努力中失败了
item.description: 伊朗最大的商业贷款机构之一阿扬德银行（Ayandeh Bank）在一次国家接管中被解散，这暴露了这个因坏账和监管不力而在全球孤立的行业存在的重大缺陷。【原文：Ayandeh Bank, one of Iran’s largest commercial lenders, has been dissolved in a state take-over that’s exposed major failings in a globally isolated sector dogged by bad debts and weak regulation.】

item.title: 如果停火得以维持，以色列科技界将迎来战后初创企业热潮
item.description: 在以色列-哈马斯宣布停火后的 24 小时内，特拉维夫风险基金 Aleph 的迈克尔-艾森伯格说，他的电话响个不停。【原文：In the 24 hours after the Israel-Hamas ceasefire was announced, Michael Eisenberg of Tel Aviv-based venture fund Aleph said his phone kept ringing.】

item.title: 黑客实验室老板被控试图在俄罗斯出售机密
item.description: 根据一份法庭文件和熟悉内情的人士透露，一家出售计算机漏洞的公司的一名主管被指控窃取机密，出售给俄罗斯的一个未指明的买家。【原文：A director at a company that sells computer vulnerabilities has been charged with stealing secrets to sell to an unspecified buyer in Russia, according to a court document and people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 花旗公牛梅奥称首席执行官的双倍奖金数额过大、时间过早
item.description: 花旗集团的长期大牛迈克-梅奥（Mike Mayo）说，花旗集团决定给首席执行官简-弗雷泽（Jane Fraser）发放数百万美元的留任奖金，并增设董事长头衔，这反映出花旗集团治理不善，过早地奖励了首席执行官。【原文：Longtime Citigroup Inc. bull Mike Mayo said the bank’s decision to give CEO Jane Fraser a multimillion-dollar retention bonus and the additional title of chair reflected poor governance and prematurely rewards the chief executive.】

item.title: 随着小众企业转向主流，加密货币交易量激增 30 倍
item.description: 21shares 多年来一直在华尔街的轨道之外建立自己的加密货币专营权。早在美国允许使用比特币和以太币之前，它就在苏黎世推出了交易所交易产品，为欧洲投资者提供了使用比特币和以太币的机会。【原文：21shares spent years building its crypto franchise outside Wall Street’s orbit. From Zurich, it launched exchange-traded products that gave European investors access to Bitcoin and Ether long before the US would allow them.】

item.title: 摩根大通和美国银行称美联储准备停止资产负债表流失
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.）和美国银行（Bank of America Corp.）的策略师预计，美联储本月将停止缩减其约6.6万亿美元的资产负债表，从而结束旨在从金融市场抽走流动性的进程。【原文：Strategists at JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Bank of America Corp. expect the Federal Reserve to stop shrinking its roughly $6.6 trillion balance sheet this month, bringing an end process designed to remove liquidity from financial markets.】

item.title: 法国呼吁 "灵活 "执行欧盟汽车二氧化碳排放规定
item.description: 法国表示，在欧盟寻求对新车销售实施更严格的二氧化碳排放规定时，欧盟必须保留一定程度的 "灵活性"，这是支持法国陷入困境的汽车行业的一个明确信号。【原文：France said the European Union must retain a degree of “flexibility” as the bloc seeks to implement tougher C02 emissions rules for new car sales, a clear signal in support of the country’s troubled industry.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯向华尔街提出的新要求：更少的 Neom，更多的人工智能
item.description: 2017 年，王储穆罕默德-本-萨勒曼（Mohammed bin Salman）与史蒂夫-施瓦茨曼（Steve Schwarzman）和孙正义（Masayoshi Son）并肩出席了沙特阿拉伯的首届年度金融峰会，共同揭幕了一座名为 "Neom "的下个世纪城市。这两位亿万富翁投资人迅速对这项耗资 5000 亿美元的计划大加赞赏，他们设想在这座大都市中，机器人的数量将超过人类，太阳能电池板的数量足以堆满中国的万里长城。【原文：In 2017, Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman sat alongside Steve Schwarzman and Masayoshi Son at the first iteration of Saudi Arabia’s annual financial summit to unveil a next-century city called Neom. The two billionaire investors were quick to heap praise on the $500 billion plan that envisioned a metropolis with more robots than humans and enough solar panels to fill out the Great Wall of China.】

item.title: 众议院民主党人警告：中国新签证将抢走美国科技人才
item.description: 就在特朗普政府提高技术工人和研究生进入美国的门槛之际，中国本月早些时候推出的一项改良签证计划有可能吸引走美国的技术人才，众议院中国委员会的头号民主党人如是说。【原文：A revamped visa program launched by China earlier this month threatens to lure away American technology talent just as the Trump administration is raising barriers for skilled workers and graduate students to enter the US, the top Democrat on the House China committee said.】
